answers.answer: Retinal detachments: who’s at riskThose w/ a family history of RDs, high myopia, previous eye surgery, previous eye trauma/injury, weak spots in the peripheral retina, having an RD in the fellow eye, as well as those w/ certain conditions such as Diabetes, Marfan’s, ROP, etc. are at greater risk for developing an RDRetinal detachments: symptomsflashes of light, which may look like camera flashes, or lightning bolts, visible during the day, but more likely to be seen at night or dim lightingfloaters, these come in many shapes and sizes, if you notice an INCREASE or sudden onset of these than take warningblack curtain or veil, if you notice any sign of visual loss go see an eye doctor immediatelyTo read more search for my post: FYI: Retinal Detachment 101
Asymptomatic retinal tears can occur.  They are less likely to cause a retinal detachment.Dr. O.
